Legal_Issue: Can a reference for damages be ordered before trial when part of an interlocutory injunction is dissolved?
Evidence_Assessment: Complexity in distinguishing trademark vs. non-trademark business damages
Legal_Rule: Prothonotaries may hear interlocutory applications; damages from dissolved injunctions may be addressed at dissolution or trial depending on circumstances
Procedural_Issue: Potential inefficiency and duplication if heard prematurely
Grounds_for_Claim: Defendant suffered damages due to partial dissolution of interlocutory injunction
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided at this stage; damages to be assessed at trial
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Motion denied twice: first due to ongoing cross-examinations, then by prothonotary
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Avoiding unnecessary duplication and streamlining proceedings considered fair
Applicant_Challenge: Defendant sought reference for damages following partial dissolution of injunction
Court_Result: Reference for damages postponed until trial
Defendant_Response: Moved for reference on damages after partial dissolution of injunction
Outcome: Denied â€“ remedy deferred to trial
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: No abuse of process, but premature timing
